title: Forging his chains.
author: Bidwell, George.
snippet: He paid that sum in gold. The same day witness paid the £100 note into his masters' account at the City Bank. He afterwards saw the jewelry that he had sold to George Bidwell at the Mansion House, and he identified it.

title: Forging his chains.
author: Bidwell, George.
snippet: Mr. Walter Weston Goss, cashier at the Bond Street branch of the City Bank, deposed that Messrs. Hawes & Son, jewelers, kept an account there, and on January 29th a £100 bank-note was paid into the credit of their account. [This was one of the notes paid to McDonald at the bank on January 28th, in exchange for gold.]

title: Forging his chains.
author: Bidwell, George.
snippet: He went to Turkey with Becker and Chapman, was sentenced at the same time with them to three and one-half years, and escaped after some months imprisonment. He is now serving a term of eighteen years for forgery on the Flour City Bank, of Rochester, N. Y. It was Engles or Wilkes who prepared the forged paper presented by him to that and other banks.

title: The life of Joseph Hodges Choate as gathered chiefly from his letters,
author: Choate, Joseph Hodges
snippet: "My old firm are turned out of 52 Wall St. after 40 years' occupation because the City Bank wants the rooms for themselves, and have taken offices at No. 60, and will give me a room for temporary shelter on my return. Mr. Southmayd goes with them and will surrender his lifelong objection to elevators.
